title._content: Baba Israel Open-Mic Session for Teens

description._content: Beat-boxer/MC Baba Israel leads an open-mic session for teens at the Brooklyn Museum. Baruch “Baba” Israel is a Hip Hop performing artist who has toured across the USA, Europe, Japan, New Zealand and Australia. He is an emcee, poet, theater artist, and beatboxer. He has released albums, co-founded Playback NYC Theater Company, and is part of the future aesthetics movement. His work has been recognized and supported by the Ford Foundation, Meet the Composer, and the Bronx Council on the arts. As an educator he works with Urban Word, Bam, Arts Horizons, and New World Theater. He co-directs Hip Hop connections which is a touring education assembly program He has performed with Full Circle on Broadway at The New Victory Theater, was stung on MTV's Hip Hop practical joke show with Method Man and Red Man, and was featured on BET's 106th and Park. He is currently an MFA candidate at Goddard College and unites his passion for Hip Hop and Education. “A true poet” New York Times. www.openthoughtmusic.com Graffiti Brooklyn Museum June 30 - September 3, 2006 www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibit ions/graffiti/
